treks.title: Damodar Kunda Trek
treks.short_description: Remote spiritual pilgrimage to sacred Damodar Kunda lakes at 4,890m. Combines Upper Mustang trek with high-altitude lake pilgrimage. For experienced trekkers only.
treks.review_text: Most remote and sacred pilgrimage trek. Very few trekkers attempt this. Physically demanding with exceptional spiritual rewards. Sacred for both Hindus and Buddhists.

hero_section.title: Damodar Kunda Trek
hero_section.subtitle: Spiritual pilgrimage to sacred high-altitude lakes at 4,890m

sections.heading: Trek Overview of Damodar Kunda Trek
articles: The Damodar Kunda Trek is Nepal's most remote and spiritually significant pilgrimage trek. This 20-day journey takes you through Upper Mustang's desert landscapes to sacred Damodar Kunda lakes at 4,890m - the highest pilgrimage site in the region. Damodar Kunda is sacred for both Hindus and Buddhists, believed to be Shiva's sacred location. The trek is extremely demanding, combining high altitude exposure, remote location, sparse facilities, and long trekking days. Maximum 4,890m requires excellent acclimatization. Only 50-100 trekkers attempt this annually. Experienced trekkers with high-altitude experience (EBC or higher altitude treks) are essential.

itinerary_days.title: Arrive Kathmandu
itinerary_days.description: Arrive in Kathmandu. Permit preparation, guide briefing, gear checking.

itinerary_days.title: Kathmandu to Pokhara
itinerary_days.description: Flight or drive from Kathmandu to Pokhara. Rest and prepare for trek.

itinerary_days.title: Fly Pokhara to Jomsom, trek to Kagbeni
itinerary_days.description: Scenic flight to Jomsom (2,720m), then trek to Kagbeni - gateway to Upper Mustang.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Kagbeni to Chele
itinerary_days.description: Enter Mustang's arid zone. Trek along ancient caravan routes through desert landscape.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Chele to Samar via Talkam La and Dajori La passes
itinerary_days.description: Cross two high passes (3,624m and 3,735m) with views of Tilicho and Yakawa Kang mountains.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Samar to Syanbochen
itinerary_days.description: Trek through high desert with minimal vegetation. Acclimatization day at moderate altitude.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Syanbochen to Ghami
itinerary_days.description: Trek through ochre hills. Visit Ghami's famous 250-meter Mani wall (longest in Mustang).

itinerary_days.title: Trek Ghami to Charang
itinerary_days.description: Trek through desert landscape. Charang sits above ochre cliffs. Old monastery with local traditions.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Charang to Lo Manthang
itinerary_days.description: Dramatic ascent to Lo La Pass (3,950m). Enter walled city of Lo Manthang at 3,840m.

itinerary_days.title: Rest day in Lo Manthang
itinerary_days.description: Explore walled city, royal palace, monasteries. Acclimatization for high altitude trek ahead.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Lo Manthang to Yara
itinerary_days.description: Trek to Yara village. Prepare for remote Damodar Kunda trek section (most challenging part).

itinerary_days.title: Trek Yara to Luri Gompa to Ghuma Thanti
itinerary_days.description: Side trip to ancient Luri Gompa (700-year-old monastery) with 15th-century cave murals. Trek to Ghuma Thanti camp.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Ghuma Thanti to Bas Khola (High Camp)
itinerary_days.description: Strenuous trek across rugged, barren terrain at extreme altitude. Highest daily challenge.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Bas Khola to Damodar Kunda (Sacred Lake)
itinerary_days.description: Final push to Damodar Kunda at 4,890m. Long, steady climb. Spiritual destination. This is the 'crown' of the trek.

itinerary_days.title: Rest day at Damodar Kunda
itinerary_days.description: Explore sacred lake area. Spiritual reflection and recovery. Stunning views of Damodar Himal (6,706m).

itinerary_days.title: Trek Damodar Kunda to Ghuma Thanti (Descend)
itinerary_days.description: Begin descent retracing path. Easier on body than ascent.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Ghuma Thanti to Tangye
itinerary_days.description: Descend to Tangye village. Return to Lower Mustang region.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Tangye to Tetang to Muktinath
itinerary_days.description: Trek to Muktinath Temple (3,760m). Complete sacred pilgrimage cycle.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Muktinath to Jomsom
itinerary_days.description: Descend to Jomsom. Prepare for return flights.

itinerary_days.title: Fly Jomsom to Pokhara to Kathmandu
itinerary_days.description: Flights back to Kathmandu. Trek completion celebration.

highlights.title: Damodar Kunda Sacred Lake
highlights.description: Sacred pilgrimage site at 4,890m. Holy for Hindus (Shiva connection) and Buddhists. Only 50-100 trekkers attempt annually.

highlights.title: Luri Gompa Monastery
highlights.description: 700-year-old cliffside monastery with 15th-century murals, cave dwellings, and Buddhist art treasures.

highlights.title: Lo Manthang Walled City
highlights.description: Ancient kingdom with monasteries, royal palace, and time-preserved Tibetan culture.

highlights.title: Extreme Altitude Challenge
highlights.description: 4,890m altitude demands excellent acclimatization and physical fitness. Ultimate high-altitude pilgrimage.

highlights.title: Remote Spiritual Journey
highlights.description: Most remote pilgrimage trek in Nepal. Few trekkers, pristine wilderness, deep spiritual significance.

cost.title: Cost Includes / Excludes
cost_inclusions: Porter support for camping gear and food
All meals during trek (breakfast, lunch, dinner)

cost_and_date_section.intro_text: Damodar Kunda operates primarily in autumn (September-November) and early winter (December). Snow and extreme cold in winter make it inaccessible most of the year.

date_highlights.highlight: Autumn (Sept-Nov): Best season, clear visibility, stable weather, essential for success
Early Winter (Dec): Possible but risky, extreme cold, early snow, for experienced only

questions.question: Who can trek Damodar Kunda?
questions.answer: Only experienced high-altitude trekkers. Prerequisite: Everest Base Camp trek or higher altitude trek. Excellent physical fitness (VO2 max testing recommended). Previous altitude sickness experience essential. Not suitable for first-time altitude trekkers.

questions.question: What altitude experience is required?
questions.answer: Minimum: EBC trek (5,364m). Recommended: Prior 5,000m+ peak summits. This trek reaches 4,890m with sustained exposure. Altitude acclimatization is non-negotiable.

questions.question: Is this trek life-threatening?
questions.answer: It carries real risks: extreme altitude, remote location (no rescue access), harsh weather, limited facilities. Guides monitor for altitude sickness closely. Turnaround decisions made on trek if needed. Not recommended for people with altitude sickness history.

questions.question: Why is Damodar Kunda sacred?
questions.answer: Damodar Kunda is sacred in Hindu belief (connected to Lord Shiva) and Buddhist pilgrimage. The twin lakes at 4,890m are believed to hold spiritual power. Pilgrims visit for spiritual cleansing and blessings.

questions.question: Can non-believers trek it?
questions.answer: Yes. The trek offers spiritual significance for believers and extraordinary high-altitude adventure for others. Respect the site's sacredness. Most trekkers experience spiritual transformation regardless of prior beliefs.

gallery_images.title: Damodar Kunda Sacred Lake
gallery_images.caption: Twin sacred lakes at 4,890m - the trek's ultimate destination.

gallery_images.title: Damodar Himal Peak
gallery_images.caption: 6,706m peak towering above the sacred lake.

gallery_images.title: High Altitude Camps
gallery_images.caption: Tent camping at 5,000m+ in remote wilderness.

elevation_chart.title: Elevation Profile - Extreme High-Altitude Trek
elevation_chart.subtitle: Altitude progression showing extreme elevation challenge

points.title: Ghuma Thanti
points.description: Base camp for sacred lake push

additional_info_sections.heading: Critical Information
articles: This is Nepal's most remote and challenging pilgrimage trek. Only 50-100 trekkers attempt it annually. Very few complete it.
Travel insurance with high-altitude coverage and emergency evacuation (minimum USD 50,000 evacuation coverage) is MANDATORY, not optional.
Turnaround decisions will be made if weather, altitude sickness, or physical condition deteriorates. Success is not guaranteed.
Last supplies purchased in Pokhara. No resupply possible after Yara. All food and equipment must be carried or porter-carried.
Medical facilities: Jomsom has basic clinic. Beyond that, helicopter evacuation is only option (extremely expensive - USD 3,000-5,000+).
Pre-trek acclimatization highly recommended: 2-3 days in Pokhara/Jomsom before starting trek.
